reviews.text: Increadable place to visit , not so many such great examples to hold and save soviet era heritage ! You shall see there and fill the atmosphere. As well it is great regards to modern Romania government to hold and develop the place as offices of Parliament and the same time the event place that really earns money for the state ! Best wishes & go to see it !

The second largest building in the world,  an extraordinary place with great chandeliers. Even if you get to visit only a small part of the building it is still impressive. It’s a must for everyone, even for the locals who, in general, don’t have the tendency to visit their own places.

yes! it’s superbe! and yet you get to visit a small part of the palace. but still impressive. even with the old smell, even with the serious guards at the security check it still is impressive. purely incredible. it’s a must for everyone! even for the locals who, in general, don’t have a tendency to visit their places.

It is an imposing building, located in the city center. It is very easily accessible as there is a metro station very close by. But again, if you drive by car, there is a possibility of parking nearby. Its interior is just as impressive, and if there is time, it certainly deserves an extended visit.
The second biggest administrative building in the world is for definitely worth visiting in Bucharest. Plus you can catch an amazing sunset!

The place well kept and very impressive. Could enter the building via the side entrance. Sadly there was no markings. Was informed by the door man at the time. Internally the hall is perfect and you could walk around with no issues. Would advise going when there is a concert. So ideal for the music lovers in life. So overall beautiful building, worth the visit, but better when there Is music.

It is a must see place in Bucharest. I think there are concerts almost every day.  The interior of the great hall is truly magnificent. On its ceiling there are written all great sciences and the great minds of Romanian history, but what stands out more is the panoramic wall painting or mural which depicts the most important events of Romanian history's last two millennia. It is an architectural beauty, and a symbol of Romanian culture. I really liked it, and I hope you will too.

The Romanian Athenaeum is one of the buildings you just have to see if you're in Bucharest. I had the pleasure of attending concerts and recitals there and was wowed by the ornate interiors. I held back on giving a five star rating because, especially for someone as tall as I am, the chairs have no leg room, and some parts of the building could use some restoration.

Beautiful interior and exterior. Entrance to the right (not signposted). You pay the man there 10RON and he gives you a ticket. Make sure you go upstairs to see the theatre it’s incredible!! Just wow!!

Amazing place to visit if you're in town. If you get the chance you should drop by for a concert, the concert hall is incredibly immersive, if not you should get the tour of the place. There's a small entrance by the right side of the building and the security guards will take you around and tell you about the place and then let you walk around the place for however long you want, just try to not break anything! (quick tip: there's a basement as well with a huge central pillar which holds most of the upper building weight).

In simple terms the outdoor items are falling apart due weather wear and tear. The indoor exhibits are good and as you through the building you will be surprised the size and depth of the building. Not much in the English translation but planes tell a lot. For a museum the indoor exhibits are very good. But the outdoor looks like a scrap yard or dumping ground for old decommissioned equipment. Worth a look but do not expect miracles. For what you pay it is fair.

You can see here helicopters, fighter jets and old memorabilia connected to aviation history. There are 2 large hangars in which the exhibits are well kept, the stuff that is kept outside could use a new repainting. You can easily spend an hour or two here. Worth a visit if you can get there, it's a bit off the beaten track for tourists. This time off the year it's open from 9 to 15:30 with 14:30 last entry. Tickets cost 10 Ron for adults and  half for children, the soldier at the gate said my daughter could enter free of charge.

They have some very interesting aircraft, but they need to be restored and properly displayed. It seems to be like a communist era museum. Needs to be more interactive. Needs a coffee shop and a gift shop. Great potential for a very attractive museum but investment is needed.
It's beautiful and you can learn a lot about Romania's airplanes history.

Interesting Old museum with a range of old planes (MIG's) from WW2 (and not only) that needs a larger place for a proper exibition of those. We have a history also in aviation and we need to share this with the people. I just found out, visiting the museum, that we had women's in aviation and mens that were pioneers frying a certain type of plane. Why this is not shared in local news..?!? This museum is also not known to the public. It's not so great as the museums in other countries but he exists and needs investments to continue to exist. The planes from outside area are left to die, needs a little paint. They are lovely to see, and must confess that i didn't saw those in other museums from around the world. Some new helicopters outside that we see also at Bias. Worth to mention that some of the explanations are also in english. What is inside hangar  needs english translation, because the info is very interesting, explaining a day in live of an aviator. It will help if the museum would have some interactive parts..maybe leave the simulators to be touched and tried by the public. Also, not only the planes needs explanation, you can add other interesting facts, stories from the military and aviation personnel.

Unfortunately, the entire area is presently undergoing renovation and view is blocked by huge green barrier screens. (Visited October 20, 2018). 

But as you walk along the Old Town street Strada Franceză you will find a convenient opening in the screen (if still there!) which is located just in front of the statue of Vlad himself!  But the walking area is very tight and people tend to gather to get a photo so have your camera ready. 

Not much else to see though.....
Cool place, but will be better when construction is finished.
Nice historical spot.  Be aware of construction though - may not be able to ‘enjoy’ it like you could when they are not working on it

Have thief standing by around here! My wife’s wallet got stolen when she enter the church. There is a couple blocking the door and act strange when we try to get in! The police here is 200% unfriendly and unhelpful as well! Dun come here unless you wanna have stuffs lost and deal with unhelpful police in Romania.

There’s a hole in the green fence where you can peek through and see the statue.    

I wouldn’t complain...it’s good they are doing renovations around here

one of my worst museum experiences. not due to the museum but the stuff. one really bored employee had to follow me around,  turning on the lights on every floor and then making me fell really uncorfotable. it was like hebwas rushinh me to leave. oh, and at the third floor he told me no photos.
It is going to be renovated soon. I'm very excited! But there's plenty to see at the moment as well since inside is the fireman museum.

If you are in this area you MUST visit Foisorul de Foc Firefighter Museum.
You are allowed to climb on the top floor of this tower where you will have a beautiful view over this old neighbourhood.
i come here every day
The history behind this monument is very interesting.

One of the most interesting museums of Bucharest, for Romanians and foreigners alike. A very complete collection of real traditional clothing and a good display of folk art. Congratulations to the management team for making the place a cool place, with theater plays, concerts, small and folk artist exhibitions.
Went there for Mărțișor.. Very nice things to buy, hand-made trinkets and souvenirs. Every weekend there is a peasent market. Definitely a must.
If you want to know old traditional Romanian village, this is the place  that deserves to pay a visit. Located in Bucharest therefore, for a short trip  or city brake  is perfectly suited.

Only giving this one star as it's closed and has been since 2016 apparently. The nice lady in the gift shop, which is oddly still open, said it may open in Sept 2019, when the renovations are complete. Personally, I'd check first.
Martisor Fair is wonderful to check out and useful to find a beautiful Martisor

Fabulous museum. 10 lei entry. Lockers available but you need a 0.50 lei coin. Wonderful information on the history of Romania, then there is a Roman section with all the amazing friezes from the Roman column of traian. The treasury with all the gold and jewels is amazing! National costumes on the way out and a gun exhibition on until the end of April. Last tickets at 4.15pm. Need around 1hour.

Small museum with great stuff. We enjoyed the temporary exhibit. We learned a lot about how Romania came to be in it's modern form. The jewelry and sparkly things were awesome. That was only part of the museum not in English.

A great way to spend the day, if you have the time. Several exhibits have fantastic paintings, sculptures and tapestries from all over Europe, with the Romanian historical exhibit displaying a large collection that I'm sure can not be found anywhere else.

I got a bit disappointed. It was not as big as I expected it to be. Surely there has been made a quite amount of effort and the treasure rooms were interesting. Hope that the next time there will be a bigger variety of exhibits.
Very impressed with the exhibits. Surprised there was no mention of the time around 1989. For 10 lei it's a great destination and the souvenir shop is reasonably priced.

A little off the beaten track but worth the visit. Good combination of everything from tanks to history and aircraft. As you enter the main building you can see cannons and guns from the earlier times and on your right more modern equipment. Main building gives the early years which is impressive, sometimes with a English translation which makes things easier. The heating was on at a very toasty 24 deg a little warm this time of year. In the back of the building there is a courtyard full of varying equipment which sadly is decaying over time. There are three other buildings one on transport at the back which was locked at the time. One on aviation, and another on arms. Very impressive. Overall worth a visit for anyone with a military interest.

The museum is OK, reasonable amount of exhibits and plenty of old military vehicles in the courtyard. What lets it down are the lack of explanations relating to exhibits or anything else. No map provided to help patrons find particular exhibits/areas of interest, staff not unfriendly, nor enthusiastic or overly helpful. One certainly didn't meet anyone who had any passion for sharing history with patrons which has been commonplace at nearly every other museum one has visited in my lifetime. In comparison to other museums it's pretty poor but if you have time to kill and are in the area it's worth a visit, I wouldn't advise anyone to go out of their way to visit unless you are a huge fan of real life tanks and other military vehicles as seeing them up close in the flesh is really the only selling point of the place.

Great museum, but be aware there are not a lot of explanations inside. The museum assumes a good knowledge of the Romanian history.  The decaying military vehicles in the courtyard are very interesting to explore.

Great place to visit in Bucharest, hosting an impressive collection of objects from the Romanian military history. It covers all the historical times from the bronze age to contemporary present day. Make sure you also go to the courtyard behind the main building where for real size military equipments like tanks, guns, trucks & even aircrafts. 

As well, there are 3 other pavilions situated in the back of the main building that host collections of military transport vehicles & chariots, military uniforms & weapons. 

Prices range from 5 lei (children & students) to 20 lei (adults). Just make sure you have cash with you because you can't pay by card at the entrance.

A great museum where you can learn a lot about Romania's history from a military point of view. It features from crude stone tools to rockets used until the 1990's. Small scale fortification and castle models. A lot of maps and uniforms. And from small artillery guns that could be towed by horses to train fixed heavy artillery guns. Tanks, planes, armoured carriers old and relatively new.
There is a main museum, in another building a level for guns and a level for uniforms, another building for aviation related stuff and also one building.(which was closed) with parachutes and related material.
Very cute, but small museum. I would recommend it for train enthusiasts and kids.
Perfect and very low entrance fee. Worth visiting as much as possible.

If you want to see how the Romanian Railway Network (Caile Ferate Romane CFR) was build or learn about its history this the right place to be. If you are quite the enthusiast you will find a relatively big model trains show here. This also is also the perfect place to bring your kids. The entrance to the museum is from inside the railway station. Tickets are quite cheap.
Awesome place ! To go and go back.. never seen such a thing before.
Cool place, my kids love it, especially the nice diorama

A hidden gem! The exposition is arranged with taste and some nice ideas. Also the atmosphere of the old house of Dr. Severeanu is somehow preserved, which adds to the experience. A must-see in Bucharest, especially for the fans of archeology!

Beautiful objects from antiquity with an abundance of coins. The mummy’s hand was a highlight as were the fire places and some of the smaller sculptures. Some golden jewelry.
Short and sweet

Excellent looking house with great finishing on the interior design and architecture.
It used to be a mansion but they have turned it into a small museum which impresses with it's style and refinement.
It's a great place to visit if you can spare a few hours.
Awarding only 4 stars as it lacks interactivity and it's smallish
There is an impressive collection of things, some of them historical important, in a very nice building. The lady that was working there was very kind and welcomed.
Amazing small museum, in the former house of the doctor who owned the collection. Many antics, artefacts and coins.

Fabulous museum. 10 lei entry. Lockers available but you need a 0.50 lei coin. Wonderful information on the history of Romania, then there is a Roman section with all the amazing friezes from the Roman column of traian. The treasury with all the gold and jewels is amazing! National costumes on the way out and a gun exhibition on until the end of April. Last tickets at 4.15pm. Need around 1hour.

Small museum with great stuff. We enjoyed the temporary exhibit. We learned a lot about how Romania came to be in it's modern form. The jewelry and sparkly things were awesome. That was only part of the museum not in English.

A great way to spend the day, if you have the time. Several exhibits have fantastic paintings, sculptures and tapestries from all over Europe, with the Romanian historical exhibit displaying a large collection that I'm sure can not be found anywhere else.

I got a bit disappointed. It was not as big as I expected it to be. Surely there has been made a quite amount of effort and the treasure rooms were interesting. Hope that the next time there will be a bigger variety of exhibits.
Very impressed with the exhibits. Surprised there was no mention of the time around 1989. For 10 lei it's a great destination and the souvenir shop is reasonably priced.

Fabulous museum. 10 lei entry. Lockers available but you need a 0.50 lei coin. Wonderful information on the history of Romania, then there is a Roman section with all the amazing friezes from the Roman column of traian. The treasury with all the gold and jewels is amazing! National costumes on the way out and a gun exhibition on until the end of April. Last tickets at 4.15pm. Need around 1hour.

Small museum with great stuff. We enjoyed the temporary exhibit. We learned a lot about how Romania came to be in it's modern form. The jewelry and sparkly things were awesome. That was only part of the museum not in English.

A great way to spend the day, if you have the time. Several exhibits have fantastic paintings, sculptures and tapestries from all over Europe, with the Romanian historical exhibit displaying a large collection that I'm sure can not be found anywhere else.

I got a bit disappointed. It was not as big as I expected it to be. Surely there has been made a quite amount of effort and the treasure rooms were interesting. Hope that the next time there will be a bigger variety of exhibits.
Very impressed with the exhibits. Surprised there was no mention of the time around 1989. For 10 lei it's a great destination and the souvenir shop is reasonably priced.
The guard man told me that it's closed at least until September (2018).
Happy independence day of Israel
Israel
I found it closed on 30 december
Very nice old church. Paintings inside are very beautiful and the atmosphere is very silent. Spiritual place in the heart of the crowded city where you can pray and take a spiritual break.
Very nice church for pray! and very nice place to visit! they also have pray schedule during the evening.
One of the most important and worth visiting east European orthodox churches in Bucharest.
A beautiful Orthodox Church to visit when you walk around old town area in Bucharest
Opened all day long for visitors.  A guided tour is needed
Beautiful place. Free to visit. Stunning cloister as well.
Unexpectedly pretty! Really impressive and worth a visit. Felt like I left the "big city" for a while.
Little but beautiful church in the Old Town (Lipscani), you can enter inside

Awesome 1724 church, built with St Michael and Gabriel patronage.
Restored in 1904 it still impresses with its decorations and design.
Majestic structure. Must see. It's at a cosy end of the bucuresti old City.
Wonderful church, unfortunately a lot of beggars. But don't hesitate, visit it! And also other churches in Bucharest, you have a lot to see!
A really great place to charge your spiritual "batteries"!
Amazing frescos, beautifully ornate and well maintained church. it's a shame this money couldn't be spent on the swathes of homeless people outside the church and all the beggars in Bucharest.
It's worth visiting. Not the usual orthodox church that you can find in Georgia, Greece or Russia.
such a beautiful place
Nice place
Very old monastery
A peaceful place. Very nice
Splendid
Oldest Monastery in Bucharest, founded circa 1560

The botanic gardens are beautiful! Very well kept. I enjoyed the greenhouses too, such a variety of lovely plants. I can tell a lot of care goes in to looking after them. I wish there were some animals in the tropical house. Nice for an afternoon stroll.

Really blissful ..you can have a good walk here.
of course when the weather is good.. 
You can see a wide variety of flowers.. well maintained.

The Ulster museum at one corner for the park is definitely worth a visit...& there is no entry fee.
Wonderful gardens, and amazing hot houses. Beautifully set out.  And with the Ulster Museum on the grounds. Amazing.  All lovers of plant life, and Creation in general will enjoy time spent here.

Had a great day walking around the craft fair. Seen many spectacular flowers, massive vegetables and lots of stalls selling home made produces. The fudge was fantastic.

Found the Belfast ukelele jam group playing in a marquee. Wow great music.

Pleasant in the early Spring. The flowerbeds are full of vibrant colour. The hothouses are rich with blooms and scents. The lawns have not yet shaken off their winter rough and are damp, but not for long. The renovated tropical ravine is superb and the museum is nearby if it rains or you need a snack. If it's sunny, go and look at the herbacious borders; sit and listen to the bees at work.

The place well kept and very impressive. Could enter the building via the side entrance. Sadly there was no markings. Was informed by the door man at the time. Internally the hall is perfect and you could walk around with no issues. Would advise going when there is a concert. So ideal for the music lovers in life. So overall beautiful building, worth the visit, but better when there Is music.

It is a must see place in Bucharest. I think there are concerts almost every day.  The interior of the great hall is truly magnificent. On its ceiling there are written all great sciences and the great minds of Romanian history, but what stands out more is the panoramic wall painting or mural which depicts the most important events of Romanian history's last two millennia. It is an architectural beauty, and a symbol of Romanian culture. I really liked it, and I hope you will too.

The Romanian Athenaeum is one of the buildings you just have to see if you're in Bucharest. I had the pleasure of attending concerts and recitals there and was wowed by the ornate interiors. I held back on giving a five star rating because, especially for someone as tall as I am, the chairs have no leg room, and some parts of the building could use some restoration.

Beautiful interior and exterior. Entrance to the right (not signposted). You pay the man there 10RON and he gives you a ticket. Make sure you go upstairs to see the theatre it’s incredible!! Just wow!!

Amazing place to visit if you're in town. If you get the chance you should drop by for a concert, the concert hall is incredibly immersive, if not you should get the tour of the place. There's a small entrance by the right side of the building and the security guards will take you around and tell you about the place and then let you walk around the place for however long you want, just try to not break anything! (quick tip: there's a basement as well with a huge central pillar which holds most of the upper building weight).
Very nice librarian, many books available on different subjects, cosy place.
Very good selection of books.
Great selection of books
Incredible variety of books, the librarian usually is spot on in his recommendations, prices are ok.
Soooo many books

Located nearby Parliament Palace, this restaurant takes you back in time with its old times atmosphere.
Their impressive menu is mainly based on old recipes.
Here you will spend wonderful evenings with live music starting from 19:30 until the last guest.
Upon artists’ daily availability, the different music genres - about 4 during the same night - varies from opera to instrumental, to old party folk.
So it will be hard to resist not to try the dance floor also.
Expect some beautiful surprises from the owner before leaving this restaurant !
Nice old style location with live old school rkmanian music.

Impressive collection of old pictures, wall clocks, tableware & cutlery. Nice and vivacious live music. That's all about this restaurant as the food was horrible!! One dish left a mould taste but the stuff don't want and are unwilling to deal with the problem. Very disappointing  I definitely don't recommend. Purely tourist trap.
Nice service. Not the best food , but I'm sure that not everyone has the same opinion
The food was ok-ish and the service ok-ish. The location looks good, but that's all. The check also contained the tip - this is not usual in Romania, but maybe they are afraid they won't get a tip.

Get ready to... wait for it... that's it, wait for it! :(
The 'Keep on Waiting' Restaurant menu:
* half an hour for them to bring the menu
* half an hour to take your order
* at least an hour to bring your meal
Do you feel lucky? Try going at the 'Wait for it' restaurant: such a beautiful place, such a no-service location...
WAIT, I KNOW: Are you young, and broke? Do you want to impress your date with no money? Bring her / him here: They will get tired of waiting and beg you to leave. You win: a date with 0 expenses! (and also 0 calories intake)

The restorant is on perfect position on the lake. I just had a beer so I didn’t see the menu, but I’ve enjoyed the sunny terrace very much. The service is a bit slow, like everywhere in Bucharest, but it doesn’t matter when you are on vacation and not in any pressure at all.

Great location, poorly run. Pizza is ok, eatable. Pulled pork burger, not so.pulled, overcooked. It's basically a steak with bread. Pickles were long cut and thick, the bun from the supermarket, cold cheddar cheese and 3 potatoes... Too bad i didn't take a picture...

Nice view, right next to the lake. The staff is friendly and kind, but unfortunately I had a bad experience with the food. I ordered french fries with "mititei" and between my fries I found pieces of fried fish. They offered to bring me another plate, but I did not take it, since I already ate half when I found the pieces and then I lost my appetite.
Beautiful location on the lake, good food, huge salads and really friendly staff.
Mancare buna dar cu gandaci prin zona...
Casa Iancului este inchisa de ceva vreme
Ceas!

Located nearby Parliament Palace, this restaurant takes you back in time with its old times atmosphere.
Their impressive menu is mainly based on old recipes.
Here you will spend wonderful evenings with live music starting from 19:30 until the last guest.
Upon artists’ daily availability, the different music genres - about 4 during the same night - varies from opera to instrumental, to old party folk.
So it will be hard to resist not to try the dance floor also.
Expect some beautiful surprises from the owner before leaving this restaurant !
Nice old style location with live old school rkmanian music.

Impressive collection of old pictures, wall clocks, tableware & cutlery. Nice and vivacious live music. That's all about this restaurant as the food was horrible!! One dish left a mould taste but the stuff don't want and are unwilling to deal with the problem. Very disappointing  I definitely don't recommend. Purely tourist trap.
Nice service. Not the best food , but I'm sure that not everyone has the same opinion
The food was ok-ish and the service ok-ish. The location looks good, but that's all. The check also contained the tip - this is not usual in Romania, but maybe they are afraid they won't get a tip.
Bloody great place! Excellent nosh and top notch friendly service. Highly recommended.
Excellent service and the food is always very tasty. You should try the penne chicken brocoli alfredo. Really good.
Excellent. Don't miss it on any pretext.
Excellent service, great food and local wines
Best Food in Town !!! Not expansive at all and a wonderful, fancy interior !!!

Reading the reviews I was a bit iffy about visiting but I'm glad I actually went on an did it. While the chicken wings and the burgers were not the best I have head they were pretty good. The desert though, was absolutely OUTSTANDING and convinced me I have to gather my friends and come back. The waiter was also extremely nice and it made the experience all the more pleasant

One of my favorite places to eat in Bucharest. Great steaks and service. The peanut butter dessert is wonderful.
I've happened upon some really fun live music here a couple times too.
It's definitely on my list for a return visit each time I'm in Bucharest.
Great experience! Everything was spot on, food staff we even got to meet the owner who was a very nice guy. Thank you for a great night!
Tasty food, nice place! Will definitely come back.

Two of us walked in with the hope of a decent steak, some wine and in what looked like a specialised steakhouse around 730pm on this random Monday evening. There was an acute smell of seafood and the restaurant was very warm inside. There were only 3 tables dining. Wanted to sit on a larger table as the one we were ushered to for two was too small. We weren't allowed.. When asked if we were going to get the table we want, the answer was no.  So we left.  Best of luck with your restaurant if your waiters don't understand the abc of customer delight..
Super tasty food. Came here multiple times and enjoyed every meal. The service is decent, sometimes took a little longer than wished for.

Great Indian food! Prices are very ok. The less positive feedback goes to the ULTRA slow speed of the kitchen. If you have a restaurant for 50 guests, you need to have a kitchen service that can answer in real time to that demand. Only 1 waitress attending a room with more than 20 guests. Food took 2 hours to be served (group of 7). The waiting time was compensated by the great taste of every dish ordered.

An average Indian restaurant. A lot of people I know recommended this restaurant. But to me there was absolutely nothing special. Food was average but slightly pricey, portions were small, and service was very slow. We had waited around 30-45 minutes for food to arrive at the table. It is a cash only restaurant which I've never heard of before in Romania. If you are the type that craves Indian food this might be your place. But I was quite disappointed and will probably never return.

The food has an unique good flavor, especially the soups which are excellent. I went here two times and had absolutely no problems with the food or the staff. They are very friendly and welcoming people. 

Since the food is expensive it is definitely not your every day restaurant but it's ok to go once in a while here or just once to try the Indian cuisine.
Service was very good. Food was good. Third time coming here. While the food is not bad, it certainly dropped in taste since the last time a came here (almost 1 year ago).

It took the waiter 2 attempts to bring me the drink (in the end I didn't receive what I asked for). Did I order a fancy cocktail? Nope. Just a simple unsweetened lemonade. I had a boring overpriced salad with an olive. One olive! What a feast...
Book it în advance. Pizza ok, main course was really good. They have a place for kids to play👍 just for 5 lei no limit ....
Good food, great service. Scarce parking space
Celebrated my last birthday here, I had good memories with seafood and white wine. Of course the service is also very good!
Really good italian restaurant. Tasty food

I am reviewing the restaurant of the hotel, not the hotel itself and the accommodations. I have come here multiple times to eat lunch here. The hotel restaurant has a daily all-you-can-eat regime menu. The dishes served each day are rather diverse and the quality of the dishes is very high. That plus a nice staff, somewhat classy atmosphere and excellent price make this an easy choice for everyone in the area that wants to enjoy a good lunch.

I stayed at Hotel Capitol for almost 2 weeks. I was traveling for business. My guess is that the building was renovated not so long ago. It's quite clean though I found a paper clip on the floor of my room and it remained there for my entire stay - meaning nobody vacuumed there or wasn't really thorough. Also the toiled smelled a little sometimes, not always though (or maybe I got used to it). I was not a big fan of the breakfasts either. The bread was okay but not the freshest, the toast bread was dry and hard. Not much of a choice regarding what to put on that bread too. When you enter the restaurant to grab the breakfast there is no one standing by the door usually. Sooner or later one of the waiters would come up to you and ask you for your room number. Sometimes they looked displeased, sometimes scared and once I encountered a nervous lady who didn't understand the room number in English. I had to point the number on the page for her.
That being said I am quite happy with my stay. The room smelled sweet and nice every time I entered. I appreciate that during the weekend the cleaning lady saw me leaving for breakfast in the morning and cleaned my room before I came back. The reception staff was the nicest and very helpful (with one exception when I was told that nothing can be done about my request, later on I asked a different person and there was no issue with doing what I asked for). I would like to say extra thank you to Georgia, receptionist who was the sweetest to me.

No way this is a four star hotel. The rooms were to small for a couple, the food was average at best. Some of the staff were not pleasant.
Most disturbing was the shower - the water suddenly go very hot and than very cold by itself! We almost got a burn when we showered. Definitely won't be coming there again.
Great choice of foods and being all you can eat makes it a really good offer. The looks of the place and life piano music it's a bonus

The hotel was good only problem we had was we booked a taxi from the hotel, ended up paying for times more than we should have . Hotel said they would look into it but we just got blanked by the reception when we left. Okay it was 4am when we left but the hotel had 24 hours to sort it out. Moral of the story don't get a taxi from this hotel put the uber so on your phone and use them it was a quarter of the price
